{{also|koffer}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From late {{inh|de|gmh|koffer}}, from {{der|de|dum|coffer}}, from {{der|de|fro|cofre}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈkɔfɐ/}} * {{audio|de|De-Koffer.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m||Koffer|Köfferchen}} # a [[case]]; a [[suitcase]] or [[briefcase]] ====Usage notes==== * A typical {{m|de|Koffer}} has a fairly inflexible, narrow and rectangular form, while a typical {{m|de|Reisetasche}} is flexible and broader (like a [[holdall]] or [[duffel bag]]). Other forms, such as [[trolley cases]], may be referred to with either of the two words. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|s}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Aktenkoffer}} * {{l|de|Kofferraum}} * {{l|de|Kofferwort}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|dsb|kofer|bor=1}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|Gepäck}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Containers]] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|gmh|kupfer}}, from {{inh|lb|goh|kophar}}, from {{der|lb|la|cuprum}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|Kupfer}}, {{cog|nl|koper}}, {{cog|en|copper}}, {{cog|is|kopar}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈkofɐ/}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|m|-}} # [[copper]] (metal) [[Category:lb:Chemical elements]]
